intro: Phyllactis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican blister beetle, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, glandular, and often sticky leaves that can release a caustic sap. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky latex. Phyllactis mexicana typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrublands or thorn forests. Its unique chemical properties have made it a subject of interest in both botanical and pharmacological research.
